name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-011 Drainage (Cast In-situ Structures) Checklist - Rev.7
template name: INF-HSEQ CC0375-ITP-011 Drainage (Cast In-situ Structures) Checklist - Rev.7

name: Ref docs - Issued drawings / Site copy drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Check that you have the latest site and engineering drawings BEFORE starting each task/set of tasks.
Acceptance Criteria - Prepare a lot map for traceability of the work area
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Setout pits to the location and levels on the drawings. This shall be presented for inspection by the superintendent.
Acceptance Criteria - Excavate to the depth nominated on the drawings and remove any loose material at the base.
○ Ensure excavation is carried out to a width which will not impede external formwork.
Acceptance Criteria - Any Unsuitable Material to be removed to the depth as directed by the Superintendent
Acceptance Criteria - Foundation (including any unsuitable replacement) to be compacted to a relative compaction of 95% to a depth of 150mm below foundation level
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.6]
Acceptance Criteria - Foundation to be inspected by the Superintendent prior to placing blinding
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.6]
Acceptance Criteria - Blinding (15MPa) for Reinforced Concrete Bases to be a 50mm thick mass concrete layer.
○ Unreinforced bases can be poured directly on the earth
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.3], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork installed as per drawings and adequately supported.
○ Completed formwork to be inspected by the Superintendent prior to concrete placement
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.5], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcement installed as per drawings, ensuring sufficient lap length and cover is achieved on all bars.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.3], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Formwork installed as per drawings and adequately supported.
○ Completed formwork to be inspected by the Superintendent prior to concrete placement.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.5], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Reinforcement installed as per drawings, ensuring sufficient lap length and cover is achieved on all bars.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.3]
Acceptance Criteria - Inlet and outlet pipes to be integrally cast into pit walls and the joint waterproofed as per design requirements.
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.8, 4.9, 4.10, 4.11], Drawings
Acceptance Criteria - Concrete strength of cast in-situ units shall be min. Grade N32 or as otherwise stated on drawings.
○ Ensure the temperature of freshly mixed concrete is maintained in between 5°C and 35°C. Ensure elapsed time between batching and discharge of the mix complies with the below table.
Concrete temperature at time of discharge (C) || Maximum elapsed time (hours)
○ Concrete placed in layers ≤ 300mm thick and adequately vibrated avoiding over-vibration.
○ Design slump shall not exceed 75mm unless shown otherwise on the drawings.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.2]
Acceptance Criteria - The nominal rate of sampling shall be taken:
(a) Compressive strength: One set per pour or as otherwise directed by the Superintendent;
(b) Slump: One per batch of concrete
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Average compressive strength at 28 days meets minimum design requirements
○ Slump within tolerances specified in AS 1379
Testing to be in a NATA accredited test facility
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Ref docs - Spec. 0319 Minor Concrete Works [Cl 4.13]
Acceptance Criteria - From completion of finishing; cure continuously with either curing compound, wet curing or form retention until 15MPa is achieved unless directed otherwise by the superintendent
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.3]
Acceptance Criteria - Access covers, grates and frames to be installed as per AS 3996
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.3]
Acceptance Criteria - Pits deeper than 600 to be fitted with galvanised plastic-coated step irons as per AS1657
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.5]
Acceptance Criteria - Provide a 10mm isolation joint in between precast pits and any abutting concrete pavement, kerb and gutter or concrete structure
Ref docs - Spec. 1354 Stormwater Drainage Structures [Cl 3.7], Spec. 1112 Earthworks [Cl 4.10]

Acceptance Criteria - Backfill shall not commence until the compressive strength of concrete has reached at least 15MPa unless otherwise approved by the superintendent. (Wingwalls shall have no backfill placed until 21 days after casting)
○ Drainage Structures to be backfilled in 150mm thick layers for a horizontal distance of one third of the height of the structure.
○ Backfill to be Select fill for material within 1.5m of pavement and General Fill below 1.5m deep.
○ Select backfill material to be a granular material with a maximum particle size of 50mm and a PI between 2 & 12
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Minimum relative compaction requirements for backfill against pits to be:
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - Moisture Content for Backfill material to be within 60% to 95% OMC unless otherwise approved by Superintendent
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance Criteria - An as-built survey of the drainage system been completed to ensure all structures are within construction tolerances.
Remarks / record (eg. test frequency, reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
5.2 - Acceptance and closure of non-conforming items
Acceptance Criteria - NCRs to be opened for non-conforming items and closed prior to closing construction lot.
